alert.note: Alert for Cobb; Douglas; North Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 5:09PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of DeKalb, northeastern Fayette, southeastern Cobb, southeastern Douglas, southwestern Gwinnett, Fulton and Clayton Counties through 545 PM EST... At 509 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Six Flags Over Georgia to Chattahoochee Hills, and moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Atlanta, Douglasville, Decatur, Jonesboro, City of South Fulton, Smyrna, East Point, Union City, Forest Park, Snellville, Riverdale, College Park, Fairburn, Lilburn, Chamblee, Clarkston, Morrow, Hapeville, Stone Mountain and Palmetto. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for north central Georgia.
